00020 /**
00021  * @file   RowFile.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Mon May 23 11:27:16 2005
00024  * 
00025  * @brief  Class for dealing with line oriented files.
00026  */
00027 
00028 #ifndef ROWFILE_H
00029 #define ROWFILE_H
00030 
00031 #include <cstring>
00032 #include <fstream>
00033 #include <map>
00034 #include <string>
00035 #include <vector>
00036 //
00037 
00038 /**
00039  *  RowFile
00040  * @brief Class for reading line oriented files and parsing them
00041  * out into vectors of strings easily.
00042  */
00043 class RowFile {
00044 
00045 public:
00046   
00047   /** Line endings are platform specific, this encodes different types
00048       we know of. */
00049   enum FileLineEnding {
00050     UNIX = 0,   // '\n'
00051     DOS = 1,    // '\r\n'
00052     MAC = 2,    // '\r'
00053     UNKNOWN = 3 // ???
00054   };
00055    
00056    /**
00057     * Constructor. Open an object with delimiter and comment
00058     * characters. 
00059     * @param delimChar - word delimiter character.
00060     * @param commentChar - line comment character. 
00061     * @param commentChar2 - second line comment character. 
00062     */
00063    RowFile(char delimChar = '\t', char commentChar = '#', char commentChar2 = '%');
00064 
00065    /** 
00066     * @brief Destructor.
00067     */
00068   ~RowFile();
00069    
00070   /**
00071    * Open file fileName or die trying.
00072    * @param fileName - full path of fileName to be opened.
00073    */
00074   void open(const std::string& fileName);
00075   
00076   /**
00077    * Close file streams. 
00078    */
00079   void close();
00080   
00081   /**
00082    * Chop the next row into words and return them in the vector
00083    * squawk and die if expected number was different from number
00084    * found.
00085    * @param words - vector to fill in with words.
00086    * @param expect - number of words that should be in next row.
00087    * @return bool - false at EOF true otherwise.
00088    */
00089   bool nextRowExpect(std::vector<std::string> &words, unsigned int expect);
00090 
00091   /**
00092    * Chop the next row into words and return them in the vector
00093    * squawk and die if expected number was different from number
00094    * found. char * memory in vector is owned elsewhere and will
00095    * change after an calls to nextRow or nextLine.
00096    * @param words - vector to fill in with words.
00097    * @param expect - number of words that should be in next row.
00098    * @return bool - false at EOF true otherwise.
00099    */
00100   bool nextCStringRowExpect(std::vector<const char *> &words, unsigned int expect);
00101     
00102    /**
00103     * Chop the next row into words and return them in the
00104     * vector. char* memory in vector is owned elsewhere and will
00105     * change after an calls to nextRow or nextLine.
00106     * @param words - vector to fill in with words.  @return bool -
00107     * false at EOF true otherwise.
00108     */
00109   bool nextCStringRow(std::vector<const char *> &words);
00110   /**
00111    * Chop the next row into words and return them in the vector.
00112    * @param words - vector to fill in with words.
00113    * @return bool - false at EOF true otherwise.
00114    */
00115   bool nextRow(std::vector<std::string> &words);
00116   
00117   /**
00118    * Set the delimiter.
00119    * @param nDelim - new word delimiter.
00120    */
00121   void setDelim(char nDelim) { m_Delim = nDelim; }
00122 
00123   /**
00124    * Get the delimiter.
00125    * @return current word delimiter. 
00126    */
00127   char getDelim() { return m_Delim; }
00128 
00129   /**
00130    * Set the comment.
00131    * @param nComment - new comment character.
00132    */
00133   void setComment(char nComment) { m_Comment = nComment; }
00134 
00135   /**
00136    * Get the comment.
00137    * @return current comment character. 
00138    */
00139   char getComment() { return m_Comment; }
00140 
00141   /**
00142    * Pull the next line from the input buffer or die trying.
00143    */
00144   const std::string *nextLine();
00145 
00146   /**
00147    * Return the next line that is non-blank and doesn't start with a
00148    * comment character.
00149    */
00150   const std::string *nextRealLine();
00151 
00152   /**
00153    * Reuse the same line again.
00154    */
00155   void reuseLine() { m_Reuse = true; }
00156 
00157   /** 
00158    * @brief What line number are we reading?
00159    * @return Line number.
00160    */
00161   int getCurrentLineNumber() { return m_LineIx; }
00162 
00163   /**
00164    * Fill in a header map with data from the top of the file. 
00165    */
00166   static void readHeader(RowFile &rf, std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> > &header, 
00167                          std::vector<std::string> &lines);
00168 
00169   /**
00170    * Write out a header in #%key=value form.
00171    */
00172   static void writeHeader(std::ostream &out, const std::vector<std::string> &lines);
00173 
00174   /** 
00175    * Read in a matrix from a file. 
00176    * @param fileName - Name of file to read from.
00177    * @param matrix - where to read data into.
00178    * @param skipLines - lines (possibly header?) to skip.
00179    * @param skipCols - number of columns (row names?) to skip.
00180    */
00181   static void matrixFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00182                              std::vector< std::vector<double> > &matrix,
00183                              unsigned int skipLines=0, unsigned int skipCols=0);
00184 
00185   /** 
00186    * Read in a matrix from a file. 
00187    * @param fileName - Name of file to read from.
00188    * @param matrix - where to read data into.
00189    * @param skipLines - lines (possibly header?) to skip.
00190    * @param skipCols - number of columns (row names?) to skip.
00191    */
00192   static void matrixFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00193                              std::vector< std::vector<float> > &matrix,
00194                              unsigned int skipLines=0, unsigned int skipCols=0);
00195   
00196   /** 
00197    * @brief What type of file is this one?
00198    * @return Type of file that has been determined.
00199    */
00200   inline enum FileLineEnding getFileType() { return m_EndType; }
00201 
00202   /**
00203    * What is the name of the rowfile we're reading from?
00204    * @return name of file being read.
00205    */
00206   std::string getFileName() { return m_FileName; }
00207 
00208 private:
00209 
00210   /** 
00211    * What type of line endings do we see in this input stream? 
00212    * @param input - stream to look for '\r','\n', or '\r\n' in.
00213    * @return type of line endings we expect in the future.
00214    */
00215   enum RowFile::FileLineEnding determineLineEndingType(std::ifstream &input);
00216 
00217   /// Name of file we are reading from.
00218   std::string m_FileName;
00219   /// Stream that we are reading from.
00220   std::ifstream m_In; 
00221   /// Current line read from the file.
00222   std::string m_CurrentLine;
00223   /// Utility buffer for chopping into char *s, faster than strings.
00224   char *m_Buffer;
00225   /// Current size of the buffer.
00226   int m_BufferSize;
00227   /// Line number in file that is currently read.
00228   int m_LineIx;
00229   /// Separating delimiter, usually tab ('\t') or comma (',')
00230   char m_Delim;
00231   /// Comment character usually '#'
00232   char m_Comment;
00233   /// Secondary comment character, usually '%'
00234   char m_Comment2;
00235   /// Should we reuse the last line again?
00236   bool m_Reuse;
00237   /// What type of line endings does this stream use?
00238   FileLineEnding m_EndType;
00239 };
00240 
00241 #endif /* ROWFILE_H */
